text.p: The supervisory board of the Polish trader Best sacked the management of the firm, quoting delays in the implementation of Best's development plan, and appointed a new management, the firm said in a statement.
It said it fired president Wojciech Zurawik and deputy president Wojciech Krainski, replacing them with Krzysztof Banaszak and Piotr Kaczynski respectively, it said.
Banaszak had previously worked as the director of the board in the Gdynia shipyard while Kaczynski had been one of the directors of Bank Gdanski.
